summary:
Requests the United Nations Country Team to contribute to planning and implementation of microprojects.

 Encourages ECOWAS to develop a subregional strategy to address security threats.
The Security Council:

 Requests the Governments and relevant parties to prevent cross-border movements of armed groups and weapons as well as illicit trafficking, with assistance from UNOCI and UNMIL.

 Calls on the Government and international partners to comply with resolution 1980 and coordinate efforts to promote transparency in the security sector reform.

 Extends until 31 July 2012 the authorization for French Forces to support UNOCI.

 Requests the Secretary-General to provide a midterm report by 31 December 2011 and a final report by 30 June 2012 on the situation and implementation of this resolution.

 Requests the Secretary-General to regularly brief the Council on significant electoral process events and UNOCI's support.

 Requests recommendations on possible adjustments in UNOCI's structure and strength by 31 March 2012.

 Decides to remain seized of the matter.
